sense.def:
A strike
je dogodek, ko delavci za nekaj časa nehajo delati, da bi dosegli boljše plačilo ali delovne pogoje.

seg.quote: ...the miners' strike.

sense.def:
Kadar delavci
strike
, za nekaj časa nehajo delati, da bi dosegli boljše plačilo ali delovne pogoje.

seg.quote: Airline pilots are threatening to strike.

sense.def:
A hunger strike
je protest v obliki odklanjanja hrane.
A rent strike
je protest v obliki neplačevanja najemnine.

cit.quote: gladovna stavka; stavka z neplačevanjem najemnine

sense.def:
To strike someone or something
pomeni nekoga ali nekaj močno zadeti z delom telesa ali kakim predmetom;

seg.quote: He struck the ball beautifully.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
strikes something else
ali
strikes against something else
, se močno dotakne nečesa drugega.

seg.quote: The house was struck by lightning.
The trawler struck against the jetty.

sense.def:
Kadar bolezen ali katastrofa
strikes
, se zgodi nenadoma.

seg.quote: ...the earthquake that struck Japan last Tuesday.
When disaster strikes, you need sympathy and practical advice.

sense.def:
To strike
pomeni hitro in nasilno napasti nekoga ali nekaj.

seg.quote: Raising herself slightly, the snake strikes.
The Air Force carried out air strikes as a result of the information received.

sense.def:
Kadar ideja ali misel
strikes someone
, se je človek nenadoma domisli.

cit.quote: pasti na pamet, prešiniti, posvetiti se

seg.quote: It struck him how foolish his behaviour had been.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
strikes someone in a particular way
, na človeka naredi določen vtis.

seg.quote: Gertie strikes me as a very silly girl.
How did London strike you?

sense.def:
To be struck by something
pomeni, da nekaj na nas naredi močan vtis.

seg.quote: He had been struck by what he saw.

sense.def:
Kadar ura
strikes
, njeni udarci povedo, koliko je ura.

seg.quote: The church clock struck eleven.

sense.def:
To strike a bargain or deal with someone
pomeni, da z nekom pridemo do dogovora ali pogodbe.

seg.quote: The council hoped to strike a deal that would give it more power.

sense.def:
To strike a match
pomeni potegniti z vžigalico po trdi površini, da zagori.

seg.quote: He struck a match and put it to his pipe.

sense.def:
To strike oil or gold
pomeni s kopanjem ali vrtanjem najti nafto ali zlato pod zemeljskim površjem.

Kadar so delavci
on strike
, nočejo delati.

seg.quote: I would never go on strike for more money.

sense.def:
Kadar izrečene besede
strike a particular note
, ustvarijo določen vtis ali ozračje.

seg.quote: His words struck a slightly false note for me.

sense.def:
To strike a balance
pomeni narediti nekaj, kar je na sredini med dvema skrajnostima.

cit.quote: odločiti se za srednjo rešitev, vzpostaviti ravnotežje

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
strikes fear or terror into people
, nenadoma povzroči strah med ljudmi.

cit.quote: napolniti (s strahom ali grozo), nagnati (strah v kosti)

seg.quote: The tanks struck terror into the hearts of the peasants.

sense.def:
To be struck dumb
ali
to be struck blind
pomeni, da nenadoma ne moremo govoriti ali videti.

seg.quote: We were struck dumb with horror.

sense.def:
To strike someone down
pomeni ubiti ali hudo poškodovati nekoga.

seg.quote: Kennedy was struck down by an assassin's bullet.

sense.def:
Kadar zdravnik ali odvetnik
is struck off
, je njegovo ime odstranjeno z uradnega seznama oseb, ki smejo opravljati delo zdravnika ali odvetnika.

cit.quote: biti črtan s seznama; izgubiti licenco

sense.def:
To strike out somewhere
pomeni oditi od nekod proti določenemu cilju.

seg.quote: He struck out for the village of Tracy.

sense.def:
To strike out
pomeni tudi začeti nekaj delati brez sodelovanja z drugimi.

seg.quote: He decided to strike out on his own.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo
strikes up a conversation or friendship
, začne pogovor ali prijateljstvo.

seg.quote: Alice and I struck up a friendship immediately.

sense.def:
Kadar glasbeniki
strike up
, začnejo igrati.

seg.quote: The band had just struck up Ellington's ‘Satin Doll’.
